description.narrative: TI BiH har lämnat in en ansökan, tillsammans med budget och mål, avseende kärnstöd till kärnverksamhet, till Sida. Sida har beslutat att bevilja stöd som exklusivt får användas för implementering av TI:s kärnaktiviteter baserat på de väsentliga strategiska prioriteringarna fastlagda i TI:s strategiska plan för 2015–2020. Dessa prioriteringar är: Etablera ett starkt och produktivt samarbete med medborgare och institutioner, med ytterligare fokus på identifiering av förändringsmedel inom institutionerna; Anta och övervaka införandet och verkställigheten av anti-korruptionsstandarder och policys på alla politiska nivåer i landet, och kampen mot social rättvisa; Förstärka kapaciteten och bilden av TI BiH och förbättra organisationens position på global nivå; Eftersträvansvärda resultat i slutet av projektet är: • Ökad beslutsamhet hos individer och partners att vidta åtgärder mot korruption och delta i beslutsprocessen • Etablerade och förstärkta koalitioner och partnerskap med relevanta intressenter • Förbättrad och förstärkt lagstiftning mot korruption baserad på relevanta internationella standarder och rekommendationer • Effektivare tillämpning av lagar och normer och minskad straffrihet för korrupta handlingar • Förbättrat genomförande av strategier och planer mot korruption hos ledande institutioner • Högre nivå av integritet hos organisationer och individer • Förbättrad mottaglighet, närvaro, påverkan av, och prestationsförmåga hos, TI BiH på alla nivåer

TI BiH has submitted an application, including budget and objectives to Sida for core financial support to its core activities. Sida has decided to award a grant to be used exclusively for the implementation of the TI's core activities based on the main strategic priorities defined by its Strategic plan 2015–2020 which are: Establishing a strong and productive cooperation with citizens and institutions, with additional focus on agents of change identified within institutions; The adoption and monitoring the introduction and enforcement of anticorruption standards and policies at all levels of government in the country, and the fight for social justice; Enhancing the capacities and image of Transparency International BiH and improving the organisation’s position in the global network Desired outcomes identified by the end of the intervention are: • Increased empowerment of people and partners to take action against corruption and participate in decision-making process • Established and strengthened coalitions and partnerships with all relevant stakeholders • Improved and strengthened anti-corruption legislation based on relevant international standards and recommendations • More effective enforcement of laws and standards and reduced impunity for corrupt acts • Improved implementation of anti-corruption strategies and plans in leading institutions • Higher levels of integrity demonstrated by organisations and people • Enhanced responsiveness, presence, performance and impact of TI BiH at all levels

TI BiH has submitted an application, including budget and objectives to Sida for core financial support to its core activities. Sida has decided to award a grant to be used exclusively for the implementation of the TI's core activities based on the main strategic priorities defined by its Strategic plan 2015–2020 which are: Establishing a strong and productive cooperation with citizens and institutions, with additional focus on agents of change identified within institutions; The adoption and monitoring the introduction and enforcement of anticorruption standards and policies at all levels of government in the country, and the fight for social justice; Enhancing the capacities and image of Transparency International BiH and improving the organisation’s position in the global network Desired outcomes identified by the end of the intervention are: • Increased empowerment of people and partners to take action against corruption and participate in decision-making process• Established and strengthened coalitions and partnerships with all relevant stakeholders • Improved and strengthened anti-corruption legislation based on relevant international standards and recommendations• More effective enforcement of laws and standards and reduced impunity for corrupt acts• Improved implementation of anti-corruption strategies and plans in leading institutions• Higher levels of integrity demonstrated by organisations and people • Enhanced responsiveness, presence, performance and impact of TI BiH at all levels

description.narrative: Significant results have been achieved in the Strategic priority 1: Establishing a strong and productive cooperation with citizens and institutions, with additional focus on agents of change identified within institutions. Legal Aid Center (ALAC) acted in 240 new cases.Increased number of cases in 2020 can be partly accounted for by the pandemic, which affected all spheres of life, including trends in corruption reporting. Citizens were more likely to seek legal protection for infringement of their labour and employment rights, and a large number of enquiries concerned citizens’ suspicions that they were prevented from enjoying fundamental human rights and freedoms under the pretext of a state of emergency and/or circumstances brought about by the pandemic. Despite the fact that 2020 was marked by an unprecedented health crisis, citizens were still ready to report corruption in their immediate environment.As in previous years, the largest number of reports in 2020, a total of 100, concerned the public administration sector. This includes complaints against all institutions in BiH at all levels of government (state, entity, local) as well as those related to state-owned enterprises and public institutions. A large number of reports concerned irregularities in the recruitment of civil servants at all levels of government, recruitments in state-owned enterprises and public institutions, failure of inspection authorities to act on citizens’ complaints, violation of regulations on personal data protection, etc. A large number of reports concerned irregularities in the recruitment of civil servants at all levels of government, recruitments in public enterprises and public institutions, failure of inspection authorities to act on citizens’ complaints, violation of personal data protection regulations, etc. During the reporting period TI BiH has completed its first generation of Integrity School with two remaining modules and organized two modules of the new generation of the Integrity School. During reporting period TI BiH continued with building coalitions with governmental,non-governmental and international organizations by involving various stakeholders in the process of anti-corruption reforms. The aim of those activities was finding quality solutions and enabling more effective implementation of the reforms. TI BiH continued to cooperate with the Agency for prevention of corruption and coordination of the fight against corruption (APIK) in process of finalization of the Strategy for the fight against corruption BiH and advocating for adoption of the Strategy by the Council of the Ministers. TI BiH carried out and published the overall analysis/evaluation of the implementation of Anti-Corruption Strategy and Action Plan of BiH 2015-2019, with focus on overall effects of its implementation. During the reporting period TI BiH focused its activities on monitoring of the challenges and risks resulting from the COVID 19 pandemic, especially in the terms of distribution of the funds intended for alleviating the consequences of the pandemic, transparency andadequate distribution of the funds, but also monitoring of general implementation ofprescribed measures. During the reporting period TI BiH started with implementation of the activity related to the implementation of the methodology for assessing procurement system (MAPS) – a universal tool that aims to catalyze and accelerate the implementation of modern, efficient, sustainable, and more inclusive public procurement systems. MAPS assessment highlight where reforms are most needed and indicate how reforms can be best carried out. TI BiH developed a methodology for monitoring of concessions in BiH, as well as collected publicly available data, and started with the process of data collection by sending a request to the institutions in charge of awarding concessions by freedom of access to information act. In order to increase the transparency and make the information on functioning of StateOwned Enterprises (SOEs) available to the public, TI BIH updated its SOEs databasewith relevant information and financial/audit reports of more than 300 state-ownedenterprises for 2019. TI BiH undertook an analysis of the organizational structure ofpublic administration in BiH, identified major problems and provided recommendations for reforms, with special focus on decreasing the complexity of the administrative set-up, enhancing its functionality and identification of opportunities for decreasing the cost of public administration. TI BiH continued with its regular monitoring of the work of judiciary, with the focus on monitoring of prosecution of corruption cases, as well as accountability of the judiciary.During reporting period TI BiH prepared and published paper called “The Rule ofCartel” which discusses the political and institutional development of the post-conflictBiH, which remains a country that is still undergoing transition, based on the theoretical assumptions of the phenomena of the hybrid regimes, state capture and cartelization of politics. Moreover, publication “Gender and Corruption in Failed Democracies – Case study Bosnia and Herzegovina” was published. Considering the effects of COVID-19 pandemic, TI BiH invested additional efforts for development and upgrade of online tools for public events, as well as to purchase additional equipment for the needs of organization of public events via online platform or in hybrid format with panelist in the room and other participants online. TI BiH Strategy 2021-2030 accompanied with the Action Plan adopted by the TI BiH Assembly. TI BiH put additional focus on strengthening the capacities of its staff.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
